reviewText: We have 6 - 8 deer that eat in our backyard everyday and have grown to love seeing them. But we wanted to know much more about them. "Private Life of Deer" really educated us on so many aspects of deer life in America. This is great for kids and adults.

Saw this on PBS and enjoyed it.

While I don't think I learned much new information
about the habits of the whitetail- I watch them every day at my place- the documentary was
well enough done that I believe even the Biology professor I deer hunt with will enjoy it.
It was heartwarming to once again see sweet Blossom grow from a rescue fawn into an Ambassador (of sorts) in the community.  She gave as much love as she received.
Seller was great.  Film is very basic info about urban white-tail deer.

Found the actions of the people in the film horribly invasive. Once the film got to the group search for fawns I had to turn it off. What in people's minds do they think interfering at this level in wildlife life is okay. Attaching photos of three people man handling a new born fawn. Found the behavior in this film repulsive and too invasive. No animal should witness their newborn they are trying to protect being man handled by a group of other animals. And a group of eight adult humans should never approach a baby fawn - unbelievable the carelessness and lack of consideration for the fawn and mother.
Mother Nature at its best.
It does a good job of illustrating the behavior of deer in general. It's an informational program for hunters and outdoor enthusiast alike.
Good film , very insightful.
OK but not a lot of information.
very interesting
Very interesting and informative !!!
We always wondered about the Deer's life.  Good documentary.
Entertaining and informative!
Learned surprising info on deers.
It was an awesome movie!
Very interesting.
Nice overview documentary. The streaming was great, no issues
Interesting if your not familiar with deer.  If you are an outdoors man or woman you will find the documentary quite basic in relation to deer behavior.
Quite interesting
It was very interesting now I know why tears freeze up when they see headlights

This documentary left many basic questions I had about deer as a species unanswered. I was disappointed by the focus on a specific set of deer in a suburban neighborhood - the impressions of the human surburbanites were not scientific, and frankly I wasn't interested. Yes, deer are beautiful and cute, but I don't need or want a documentary to tell me that over and over. I wanted to know why deer form and lose antlers, what is the "velvet", why fawns have spots when young, how mothers prepare their young for yearlinghood, how families and herds interact, how deer around the world vary in habitat and coloration, and why. I wanted to learn more about non-kill efforts to curb populations. Perhaps I missed something.
There was so much good information in this program that I did not know. Very good to watch with my sons and we all learned a lot!
As always PBS does not disappoint

Love this program!  Also DVR'd this but it was deleted, so I am very happy to have found it.  Really love near the end when that lady "adopts" a fawn and names her Blossom.  Very sweet.  Another great Nature program!
You have to watch this if you live where the deer used to live.
Interesting. A little boring
Insightful, whether you are a nature lover, hunter or simply interested in learning about deer this is a must see.
Its ironic watched documentaries on a host of animals that are exotic and rate..but never learned about an animal that was browsing my bushes right outside!

Fairly informative.  However, I live in South Texas and encounter large populations of white-tailed deer on a daily basis.  This would be a good film for those who have no knowledge of the genus and are interested in knowing just the basics.
It was okay documentary. Hubby and I fell asleep.
Great little film about urbanised deer and how they interact with our world.
Der int he house was like a fairy tale.
Great look at the lives of creatures that live in close proximity to us.
Very informatve regarding the habits and behavior of the deer who live so close to many of uus.
This was a lovely documentary- informative, humorous, and well-worth watching. The first in what is probably going to be a line of Amazon documentaries for me.
I have on average 4-7 deer come to feed several nights a week. This documentary taught me a lot about what to expect from them. Excellent and educational.
Very informative!
good
Very well done documentary.  I was interested from a deer hunting standpoint and learned interesting information.

This show was a bit too slow for me especially after watching the mules deer document "Touching the wild, living with the Mule Deer of Dead Gulch which I loved.  I had to fast forward most of this show so I cannot recommend personally.
Different, but I enjoyed watching it.
This is an interesting movie for people interested in animals, as I am. Nothing to get really excited about, but it's educational.
Keep the family's attention thro the whole movie

I watched this with my 4 year old because we have a lot of deer in our neighborhood and she's always asking me about them.

I thought this was a great documentary to teach a 4 year old about what a deer is and why they come around people when other animals stay far away. My daughter was fascinated by it and now she's always looking for deer whenever we go outside. I did have to explain it to her in simpler terms at times because it's not geared to a 4 year old viewer, but it's got furry creatures on the screen nearly every second so she was captivated.

As an adult I thought it was watchable, but it's not the most interesting documentary ever. It does get into herd structure and that's interesting. But overall it probably could have been whittled down to 30 minutes.

If you see deer everywhere and want to know a little more about them, it's worth watching once.
Good flick
Fascinating hour-long show from the PBS Nature series about the animals that live so close to us in the suburbs.
Very informative...learned a great deal about our deer.
Well made and interesting.

So I watched this show thinking I knew about deer as a 30 plus year hunter.  Solid info, but only  demonstrates the true problem, man.  We deleveloped this easy evironment for the deer to live and now there is not a natural predator.  I know many of the people in this would oppose hunting.  If they would shown all sides of the issue I would gave 5 stars.
good info, older footage and not high quality production.
Loved it
Very good and informative.
Very educational, and very enjoyable.  My sons, 11 & 7, enjoyed the program as well.  Highly recommend if you're an animal lover/enjoy nature.
LEARN A LOT ABOUT DEERS
this was a great informative show!
Great show if you like wildlife.
I have whitetail in my yard daily so I especially loved learning about them.
good stuff..

Very fascinating show. I have lived around deer all my life but still learned some things.

Interesting to learn more about the animals I see out my window. :)
Love this great DVD!
great movie
Really Nice Family Movie

While I thought I knew a lot about white tail deer, I found there was much more to learn about these amazing, shy creatures.  There was a lot of scientific data shared alongside interesting anecdotal musings to keep it from being too dry. Two things struck me from this video:  1) The white tail physiological make up [eyes/sight, the diversity of plants they eat, why they rest during the day, etc.] and 2) the comment made at the end where one contributor stated that many people go to Africa to view the great herds, but we have great herds in our own back yard and sometimes forget to enjoy them.  I won't forget again.
If you're an animal lover you will enjoy this movie.
very informative
Great documentary and gave me insight into the lives of the creatures who share their home with me.
Great programming to watch with the kids
This is an awsome video,my 2 grandsons and I watched together we were in awe. If you love nature you will love it.

Couldn't sleep, was looking for a non stimulation view hoping I could get back to sleep. Found this deer documentary and have been talking about it since. Fascinating tale of deer. I leaned much And I was able to sleep after I watched it through. Recommend.  Keeps your attention throughout.
Amazingly interesting!
I love Nature programming and the Deer Life was as good as any.
Fun to watch... interesting perspectives and we still obviously have LOTS to learn about our long-time neighbors on the edge of the woods.

liked it a lot!
We got a new prospective when we see them in our yard
which is constantly
informative, They refer to the deer filmed as "wild". The deer I know of as wild won't tolerate such close human contact. still worth watching. enjoyed this and many other Nature: production's
I have hunted whitetail deer for many years. This helped me realize some of the habits that I have experienced and shines a new light on them. goood stuff
good
it was ok.
great documentary on deer.
As a deer hunter, I thought this was a nice overview of the wonderful creature!
What an awesome creature. No one should want to kill them

Interesting information, but not really comprehensive.  A lot of time spent with pictures of deer roaming around a suburban town in upstate NY. Way too many deer, but no real discussion of what to do about it. Lost interest about half way through.

Kind of a neat documentary. If you are an outdoors person or deer hunter you will like. I like watching deer any time of the year.
It's informative

Great documentary on the white tail, a fascinating animal that are our closest wild neighbors.
Learned a few things about these beautiful creatures.

This was great. There were a lot of things about deer that I did not know. The funny thing is I almost hit a deer 3 days ago. He was a big one with a huge neck from he rut. I am happy that he and I both escaped a close call.
Very enjoyable and informative.
Outstanding photography.
We see lots of deer where we live and I like to know as much as I can about these beautiful animals as I can!
Really interesting how deer adapt to humans
Just OK.  Not much on hunting, behavior or mating.  Just a lot of "look at these deer!"
Excellent view of deer in the wild.
it's worth wathing
awesome dvd

This will give many of us interesting information we may not have had before in an engaging manner, and at times it is completely fascinating. Goes down easy. In the last third, it seems to lose focus by veering off into oddities. The time used for the odditiesalthough they were certainly interestingcould have been better used by going into a little more depth on the main subject. For instance, it shows how the surprising fact that female deer also fight was discovered, but says nothing about why they do. For me, some choices made as to what to include tilted it more toward infotainment than it needed to be. Still, the production is largely successful, and perhaps the demands of a wider audience need to be acknowledged. Its nothing but good news that there is funding for projects like this. Its well edited, makes good use of short interviews, and contains some wonderful shots and sequences. I learned something and it made me happy.

This was a documentary about deer that explained many things about them that I didn't know before.  We have a lot of white tail deer coming to our yard, so I was especially interested in learning more about them.  This movie was done in a very interesting way, with lots of different footage from different areas.

The quality of the filming was not always perfect, but they did use some home-owner video to show some of the deer antics.

It was not so long that I got tired of it.  Very nice movie.
I love nature
I learned a lot about deer while watching this program. I particularly enjoyed seeing the white deer, which I have never seen before.
Fascinating
It was OK
Informative
Very interesting and good quality movie.
slow paced, repetitive, and I would have liked a more science. Nothing about the vectors for lyme and tics and the illnesses which impact people.
this was a story of deer living within a wealthy neighborhood near Cornell University.  Not exactly private.
It makes me think the deer are smarter than my grandpa said.
loved it.  I think if your a hunter you would like it too.
Ok

awesome
Great nature program for the whole family.  Very informative.

This documentary gives you a chance to learn a bit about the shy, gentle, critters that lurk around the neighborhood, stare into your car's headlights and eat your garden when your not looking.  The film provides just enough information and does not get bogged down in minute details and statistics which I'm sure most people prefer. A plus is there is nothing in the documentary that might give you concern or embarrassment when watching it with even the youngest of kids. The photography is very good and the narration is easy to listen too. Definitely worth a look, if like me, you know next to nothing about the elusive animals that live among us.
Interesting!
Good for people who have little knowledge of the white tail deer.
A nice rainy-afternoon documentary. Pleasant; no one shoots Bambi's mom so you can safely watch it with the kids
Good
Very informative about these beautiful regal creatures. Learned a lot. My 12 year old son liked it a lot also.
I was surprised to learn so many interesting facts about deer in our backyards.
Very interesting.  I learned a lot about deer that I did not know.  Love these graceful animals.  Worth spending about an hour on.

Worth watching and learned a lot about their habits.  It was interesting to see deer in the keys, smaller than usual.  I enjoyed it and though some of it was slow moving, still watched it to the end. I would recommend it.
Interesting and well crafted.  Enjoyed this peek into the white tails world.
Should have more shows like this on Prime Instant Video
Interesting information and beautiful footage.
Nice to know a little bit more about the animals that live in your back yard.
Great doc if you like whitetail deer.
This was very interesting DVD, as it is set not far from my home. It is done well and is very informative.
I am always on the lookout for good documentaries for my 12 year old daughter, and she loved this one.

I think we all love deer; however, some gun owners love to hunt and kill deer. In this video, the viewer can see how well white-tailed deer fit into our habitat. A research team in Pennsylvania has chosen a small suburb in Pennsylvania to do research on the local deer. It's amazing what they find. Also, they ask the inhabitants of the area to take photos and record their interactions for a one-year period. Watching this video will help humans see how we are the invaders of the deer habitat, not the other way around.
not worth buying but was worth watching once. I bought it just to see deer grazing through the metro areas as it is always interesting to spot them. Got kind of bored though
I love white tail deer so this was right up my alley, good info movie, very informative. as usual everything ive bought on here as of yet has been great
Really liked this DVD.  Found out lots of info, on what those little buggers do, before they run in front of your car.
This is a great gift.  I saw the movie and fell in love with it.  Didn't know all the interesting facts about deer.  Thank you and Merry Christms
A lot more interesting than I expected!
I need to know what happened to Blossom?  Was she hit by a car, shot, or die of natural causes?
This documentary is great. They dive deep into the secret social habits of the deer. I highly recommend this DVD to anyone who loves nature and animals.
I never knew. You should definitely watch.

I live in the country, with lots of deer in my yard, (which I love), so wanted to know more about them. This movie was interesting, and informative.
Really enjoyed watching it!
Very nice video
My boys, ages 1 and 5, enjoy this documentary because they love watching deer!  My husband and I are also learning interesting facts about the deer that roam our neighborhood.

We have deer and one day a coyote got one of the babies when it was very very young. A bunch of does were racing around the woods as the baby cried out - but they didn't run away. (the coyote ran when we approached, not realizing what was happening). But I wanted to understand this. Several does approached the hurt baby as well. (the baby died) This movie didn't really go into the dynamics of dear families, how they live. It was mostly about how they go about living in the suburbs, very little private about it. There was one instance where they went looking for a specific behavior and found some deer but didn't get the behavior and said, oh well, if they had behaved such and such it would look like this ... I was left wondering, well, did you try a second night? A third? So it was just OK.

It was a fairly good documentary on deer overall but I think we were looking for a more in depth study about the family unit and their intelligence  as opposed to so much focus on how they live in our neighborhoods.
Just beautiful and informative.  I live in the Missippi River and we have deer year round.  Nice to know more about them.
